response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age and Gender", "low", "At 18 years old and female, statistical trends show lower recidivism compared to older individuals or males."],
    ["Prior Arrest History", "medium", "Having one prior arrest—even without conviction—suggests some risk, though limited exposure."],
    ["Substance Use", "low", "Past use of marijuana over the last four years represents a low level of risk compared to harder substances."],
    ["Family Environment", "medium", "Living in a household with non-traditional adult figures at a young age in a larger household may indicate some instability."],
    ["Employment Stability", "medium", "Holding only one job in the past year can be indicative of limited economic or personal stability."],
    ["Educational Attainment", "low", "Having a high school diploma is standard and does not suggest high recidivism risk, though lack of further education is a neutral factor."],
    ["Marital and Living Situation", "low", "Not being married and not living alone generally does not indicate high risk; having a shared living situation can be a protective factor."],
    ["Religious Belief", "low", "Belief that God has a role in personal events can be associated with community integration and resilience."]
  ],
  "prediction": "NO",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: At 18 years old and female, statistical trends show lower recidivism compared to older individuals or males.
Having one prior arrest—even without conviction—suggests some risk, though limited exposure.
Past use of marijuana over the last four years represents a low level of risk compared to harder substances.
Living in a household with non-traditional adult figures at a young age in a larger household may indicate some instability.
Holding only one job in the past year can be indicative of limited economic or personal stability.
Having a high school diploma is standard and does not suggest high recidivism risk, though lack of further education is a neutral factor.
Not being married and not living alone generally does not indicate high risk; having a shared living situation can be a protective factor.
Belief that God has a role in personal events can be associated with community integration and resilience.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old female who identifies herself as White. She has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. She is 5 feet 5 inches and weighs 128 lbs. She has never been married and is currently not living alone. She has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. She has held 1 job during the year. She has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, she lived with adults other than biological, foster or adoptive parents in a household of size 6. She considers that God has something to do with what happens to her personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
